5.description: Discovery events report the existence and state of devices, files, configurations, processes, registry keys, and other objects.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

5018.caption: User Query
5018.description: User Query events report user data that have been discovered, queried, polled or searched. This event differs from User Inventory as it describes the result of a targeted search by filtering a subset of user attributes.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

query_info.caption: Query Info
query_info.description: The search details associated with the query request.

query_result_id.caption: Query Result ID
query_result_id.description: The normalized identifier of the query result.

1.caption: Exists
1.description: The target was found.

2.caption: Partial
2.description: The target was partially found.

3.caption: Does not exist
3.description: The target was not found.

4.caption: Error
4.description: The discovery attempt failed.

5.caption: Unsupported
5.description: Discovery of the target was not supported.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The query result is not mapped. See the query_result attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

user.caption: User
user.description: The user that pertains to the event or object.

user_query.caption: User Query
user_query.description: User Query events report user data that have been discovered, queried, polled or searched. This event differs from User Inventory as it describes the result of a targeted search by filtering a subset of user attributes.
user_query.name: user_query

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the finding activity.

1.caption: Create
1.description: A finding was created.

2.caption: Update
2.description: A finding was updated.

3.caption: Close
3.description: A finding was closed.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The finding activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

assignee.caption: Assignee
assignee.description: The details of the user assigned to an Incident.

assignee_group.caption: Assignee Group
assignee_group.description: The details of the group assigned to an Incident.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

2.caption: Findings
2.description: Findings events report findings, detections, and possible resolutions of malware, anomalies, or other actions performed by security products.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

2002.caption: Vulnerability Finding
2002.description:
The Vulnerability Finding event is a notification about weakness in an information system, system security procedures, internal controls, or implementation that could be exploited or triggered by a threat source. Note: if the event producer is a security control, the security_control profile should be applied and its attacks information, if present, should be duplicated into the finding_info object.
Note: If the Finding is an incident, i.e. requires incident workflow, also apply the incident profile or aggregate this finding into an Incident Finding.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

comment.caption: Comment
comment.description: A user provided comment about the finding.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

device.caption: Device
device.description:
Describes the affected device/host. It can be used in conjunction with Affected Resource(s).

e.g. Specific details about an AWS EC2 instance, that is affected by the Finding.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

10.caption: Exonerated

11.caption: Corrected

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated

5.caption: Deleted

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The time of the most recent event included in the finding.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

finding_info.caption: Finding Information
finding_info.description: Describes the supporting information about a generated finding.

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

impact.caption: Impact
impact.description: The impact , normalized to the caption of the impact_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

impact_id.caption: Impact ID
impact_id.description: The normalized impact of the incident or finding. Per NIST, this is the magnitude of harm that can be expected to result from the consequences of unauthorized disclosure, modification, destruction, or loss of information or information system availability.

1.caption: Low
1.description: The magnitude of harm is low.

2.caption: Medium
2.description: The magnitude of harm is moderate.

3.caption: High
3.description: The magnitude of harm is high.

4.caption: Critical
4.description: The magnitude of harm is high and the scope is widespread.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The impact is not mapped. See the impact attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

impact_score.caption: Impact Score
impact_score.description: The impact as an integer value of the finding, valid range 0-100.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

is_suspected_breach.caption: Suspected Breach
is_suspected_breach.description: A determination based on analytics as to whether a potential breach was found.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

priority.caption: Priority
priority.description: The priority, normalized to the caption of the priority_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

priority_id.caption: Priority ID
priority_id.description: The normalized priority. Priority identifies the relative importance of the incident or finding. It is a measurement of urgency.

1.caption: Low
1.description: Application or personal procedure is unusable, where a workaround is available or a repair is possible.

2.caption: Medium
2.description: Non-critical function or procedure is unusable or hard to use causing operational disruptions with no direct impact on a service's availability. A workaround is available.

3.caption: High
3.description: Critical functionality or network access is interrupted, degraded or unusable, having a severe impact on services availability. No acceptable alternative is possible.

4.caption: Critical
4.description: Interruption making a critical functionality inaccessible or a complete network interruption causing a severe impact on services availability. There is no possible alternative.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The priority is not normalized.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.

resource.caption: Resource
resource.description: Describes details about the resource that is affected by the vulnerability/vulnerabilities.

resources.caption: Affected Resources
resources.description: Describes details about the resource/resources that are affected by the vulnerability/vulnerabilities.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

src_url.caption: Source URL
src_url.description: A Url link used to access the original incident.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The time of the least recent event included in the finding.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The normalized status of the Finding set by the consumer normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized status identifier of the Finding, set by the consumer.

1.caption: New
1.description: The Finding is new and yet to be reviewed.

2.caption: In Progress
2.description: The Finding is under review.

3.caption: Suppressed
3.description: The Finding was reviewed, determined to be benign or a false positive and is now suppressed.

4.caption: Resolved
4.description: The Finding was reviewed, remediated and is now considered resolved.

5.caption: Archived
5.description: The Finding was archived.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

ticket.caption: Ticket
ticket.description: The linked ticket in the ticketing system.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

vendor_attributes.caption: Vendor Attributes
vendor_attributes.description:
The Vendor Attributes object can be used to represent values of attributes populated by the Vendor/Finding Provider. It can help distinguish between the vendor-prodvided values and consumer-updated values, of key attributes like severity_id.
The original finding producer should not populate this object. It should be populated by consuming systems that support data mutability.

verdict.caption: Verdict
verdict.description: The verdict assigned to an Incident finding.

verdict_id.caption: Verdict ID
verdict_id.description: The normalized verdict of an Incident.

1.caption: False Positive
1.description: The incident is a false positive.

10.caption: Duplicate
10.description: The incident is a duplicate.

2.caption: True Positive
2.description: The incident is a true positive.

3.caption: Disregard
3.description: The incident can be disregarded as it is unimportant, an error or accident.

4.caption: Suspicious
4.description: The incident is suspicious.

5.caption: Benign
5.description: The incident is benign.

6.caption: Test
6.description: The incident is a test.

7.caption: Insufficient Data
7.description: The incident has insufficient data to make a verdict.

8.caption: Security Risk
8.description: The incident is a security risk.

9.caption: Managed Externally
9.description: The incident remediation or required actions are managed externally.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

vulnerabilities.caption: Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.description: This object describes vulnerabilities reported in a security finding.

vulnerability_finding.caption: Vulnerability Finding
vulnerability_finding.description:
The Vulnerability Finding event is a notification about weakness in an information system, system security procedures, internal controls, or implementation that could be exploited or triggered by a threat source. Note: if the event producer is a security control, the security_control profile should be applied and its attacks information, if present, should be duplicated into the finding_info object.
Note: If the Finding is an incident, i.e. requires incident workflow, also apply the incident profile or aggregate this finding into an Incident Finding.
vulnerability_finding.name: vulnerability_finding

@deprecated.message: Use the Web Resources Activity class with the Security Control and/or Network Proxy profile instead.

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

1.caption: Access Grant
1.description: The incoming request has permission to the web resource.

2.caption: Access Deny
2.description: The incoming request does not have permission to the web resource.

3.caption: Access Revoke
3.description: The incoming request's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements.

4.caption: Access Error
4.description: An error occurred during processing the request.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

6.caption: Application Activity
6.description: Application Activity events report detailed information about the behavior of applications and services.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

6004.caption: Web Resource Access Activity
6004.description: Web Resource Access Activity events describe successful/failed attempts to access a web resource over HTTP.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

http_request.caption: HTTP Request
http_request.description: Details about the underlying HTTP request.

http_response.caption: HTTP Response
http_response.description: Details about the HTTP response, if available.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

proxy.caption: Proxy
proxy.description: Details about the proxy service, if available.

proxy_connection_info.caption: Proxy Connection Info
proxy_connection_info.description: The connection information from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_endpoint.caption: Proxy Endpoint
proxy_endpoint.description: The proxy (server) in a network connection.

proxy_http_request.caption: Proxy HTTP Request
proxy_http_request.description: The HTTP Request from the proxy server to the remote server.

proxy_http_response.caption: Proxy HTTP Response
proxy_http_response.description: The HTTP Response from the remote server to the proxy server.

proxy_tls.caption: Proxy TLS
proxy_tls.description: The TLS protocol negotiated between the proxy server and the remote server.

proxy_traffic.caption: Proxy Traffic
proxy_traffic.description: The network traffic refers to the amount of data moving across a network, from proxy to remote server at a given point of time.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

src_endpoint.caption: Source Endpoint
src_endpoint.description: Details about the source endpoint of the request.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_code.caption: Status Code
status_code.description:
The event status code, as reported by the event source.

For example, in a Windows Failed Authentication event, this would be the value of 'Failure Code', e.g. 0x18.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

tls.caption: TLS
tls.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) attributes, if available.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

web_resources.caption: Web Resources
web_resources.description: Details about the resource that is the target of the activity.

web_resource_access_activity.caption: Web Resource Access Activity
web_resource_access_activity.description: Web Resource Access Activity events describe successful/failed attempts to access a web resource over HTTP.

status_detail.description: The status detail contains additional information about the event/finding outcome.

status_id.caption: Status ID
status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event status is not mapped. See the status attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

time.caption: Event Time
time.description: The normalized event occurrence time or the finding creation time.

timezone_offset.caption: Timezone Offset
timezone_offset.description: The number of minutes that the reported event time is ahead or behind UTC, in the range -1,080 to +1,080.

tls.caption: TLS
tls.description: The Transport Layer Security (TLS) attributes, if available.

type_name.caption: Type Name
type_name.description: The event/finding type name, as defined by the type_uid.

type_uid.caption: Type ID
type_uid.description: The event/finding type ID. It identifies the event's semantics and structure. The value is calculated by the logging system as: class_uid * 100 + activity_id.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

web_resources.caption: Web Resources
web_resources.description: Describes details about web resources that were affected by an activity/event.

web_resources_result.caption: Web Resources Result
web_resources_result.description: The results of the activity on web resources. It should contain the new values of the changed attributes of the web resources.

web_resources_activity.caption: Web Resources Activity
web_resources_activity.description: Web Resources Activity events describe actions executed on a set of Web Resources.
web_resources_activity.name: web_resources_activity

action_id.caption: Action ID
action_id.description: The action taken by a control or other policy-based system leading to an outcome or disposition. An unknown action may still correspond to a known disposition. Refer to disposition_id for the outcome of the action.

0.caption: Unknown
0.description: The action was unknown. The disposition_id attribute may still be set to a non-unknown value, for example 'Custom Action', 'Challenge'.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: The activity was allowed. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Allowed', 'Approved', 'Delayed', 'No Action', 'Count' etc.

2.caption: Denied
2.description: The attempted activity was denied. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Blocked', 'Rejected', 'Quarantined', 'Isolated', 'Dropped', 'Access Revoked, etc.

3.caption: Observed
3.description: The activity was observed, but neither explicitly allowed nor denied. This is common with IDS and EDR controls that report additional information on observed behavior such as TTPs. The disposition_id attribute should be set to a value that conforms to this action, for example 'Logged', 'Alert', 'Detected', 'Count', etc.

4.caption: Modified
4.description: The activity was modified, adjusted, or corrected. The disposition_id attribute should be set appropriately, for example 'Restored', 'Corrected', 'Delayed', 'Captcha', 'Tagged'.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The action is not mapped. See the action attribute which contains a data source specific value.

activity_id.caption: Activity ID
activity_id.description: The normalized identifier of the activity that triggered the event.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event activity is not mapped. See the activity_name attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

activity_name.caption: Activity
activity_name.description: The event activity name, as defined by the activity_id.

actor.caption: Actor
actor.description: The actor object describes details about the user/role/process that was the source of the activity. Note that this is not the threat actor of a campaign but may be part of a campaign.

api.caption: API Details
api.description: Describes details about a typical API (Application Programming Interface) call.

attacks.caption: MITRE ATT&CK® Details
attacks.description: An array of MITRE ATT&CK® objects describing identified tactics, techniques & sub-techniques.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

category_name.caption: Category
category_name.description: The event category name, as defined by category_uid value.

category_uid.caption: Category ID
category_uid.description: The category unique identifier of the event.

1.caption: System Activity
1.description: System Activity events.

class_name.caption: Class
class_name.description: The event class name, as defined by class_uid value.

class_uid.caption: Class ID
class_uid.description: The unique identifier of a class. A class describes the attributes available in an event.

201003.caption: Windows Resource Activity
201003.description: Windows Resource Activity events report when a process accesses a Windows managed resource object, successful or otherwise.

cloud.caption: Cloud
cloud.description: Describes details about the Cloud environment where the event was originally created or logged.

confidence.caption: Confidence
confidence.description: The confidence, normalized to the caption of the confidence_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

confidence_id.caption: Confidence ID
confidence_id.description: The normalized confidence refers to the accuracy of the rule that created the finding. A rule with a low confidence means that the finding scope is wide and may create finding reports that may not be malicious in nature.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The confidence is not mapped to the defined enum values. See the confidence attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

confidence_score.caption: Confidence Score
confidence_score.description: The confidence score as reported by the event source.

count.caption: Count
count.description: The number of times that events in the same logical group occurred during the event Start Time to End Time period.

device.caption: Device
device.description: An addressable device, computer system or host.

disposition.caption: Disposition
disposition.description: The disposition name, normalized to the caption of the disposition_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

disposition_id.caption: Disposition ID
disposition_id.description: Describes the outcome or action taken by a security control, such as access control checks, malware detections or various types of policy violations.

1.caption: Allowed
1.description: Granted access or allowed the action to the protected resource.

10.caption: Exonerated
10.description: A suspicious or risky entity was deemed to no longer be suspicious (re-scored).

11.caption: Corrected
11.description: A corrupt file or configuration was corrected.

12.caption: Partially Corrected
12.description: A corrupt file or configuration was partially corrected.

13.caption: Uncorrected
13.description: A corrupt file or configuration was not corrected.

14.caption: Delayed
14.description: An operation was delayed, for example if a restart was required to finish the operation.

15.caption: Detected
15.description: Suspicious activity or a policy violation was detected without further action.

16.caption: No Action
16.description: The outcome of an operation had no action taken.

17.caption: Logged
17.description: The operation or action was logged without further action.

18.caption: Tagged
18.description: A file or other entity was marked with extended attributes.

19.caption: Alert
19.description: The request or activity was detected as a threat and resulted in a notification but request was not blocked.

2.caption: Blocked
2.description: Denied access or blocked the action to the protected resource.

20.caption: Count
20.description: Counted the request or activity but did not determine whether to allow it or block it.

21.caption: Reset
21.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being reset.

22.caption: Captcha
22.description: Required the end user to solve a CAPTCHA puzzle to prove that a human being is sending the request.

23.caption: Challenge
23.description: Ran a silent challenge that required the client session to verify that it's a browser, and not a bot.

24.caption: Access Revoked
24.description: The requestor's access has been revoked due to security policy enforcements. Note: use the Host profile if the User or Actor requestor is not present in the event class.

25.caption: Rejected
25.description: A request or submission was rejected. For example, when a form was improperly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 2 'Blocked'.

26.caption: Unauthorized
26.description: An attempt to access a resource was denied due to an authorization check that failed. This is a more specific disposition than 2 'Blocked' and can be complemented with the authorizations attribute for more detail.

27.caption: Error
27.description: An error occurred during the processing of the activity or request. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

3.caption: Quarantined
3.description: A suspicious file or other content was moved to a benign location.

4.caption: Isolated
4.description: A session was isolated on the network or within a browser.

5.caption: Deleted
5.description: A file or other content was deleted.

6.caption: Dropped
6.description: The request was detected as a threat and resulted in the connection being dropped.

7.caption: Custom Action
7.description: A custom action was executed such as running of a command script. Use the message attribute of the base class for details.

8.caption: Approved
8.description: A request or submission was approved. For example, when a form was properly filled out and submitted. This is distinct from 1 'Allowed'.

9.caption: Restored
9.description: A quarantined file or other content was restored to its original location.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The disposition is not mapped. See the disposition attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

duration.caption: Duration Milliseconds
duration.description: The event duration or aggregate time, the amount of time the event covers from start_time to end_time in milliseconds.

end_time.caption: End Time
end_time.description: The end time of a time period, or the time of the most recent event included in the aggregate event.

enrichments.caption: Enrichments
enrichments.description:
The additional information from an external data source, which is associated with the event or a finding. For example add location information for the IP address in the DNS answers:

[{"name": "answers.ip", "value": "92.24.47.250", "type": "location", "data": {"city": "Socotra", "continent": "Asia", "coordinates": [-25.4153, 17.0743], "country": "YE", "desc": "Yemen"}}]

firewall_rule.caption: Firewall Rule
firewall_rule.description: The firewall rule that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable.

is_alert.caption: Alert
is_alert.description: Indicates that the event is considered to be an alertable signal. Should be set to true if disposition_id = Alert among other dispositions, and/or risk_level_id or severity_id of the event is elevated. Not all control events will be alertable, for example if disposition_id = Exonerated or disposition_id = Allowed.

malware.caption: Malware
malware.description: A list of Malware objects, describing details about the identified malware.

message.caption: Message
message.description: The description of the event/finding, as defined by the source.

metadata.caption: Metadata
metadata.description: The metadata associated with the event or a finding.

observables.caption: Observables
observables.description: The observables associated with the event or a finding.

osint.caption: OSINT
osint.description: The OSINT (Open Source Intelligence) object contains details related to an indicator such as the indicator itself, related indicators, geolocation, registrar information, subdomains, analyst commentary, and other contextual information. This information can be used to further enrich a detection or finding by providing decisioning support to other analysts and engineers.

policy.caption: Policy
policy.description: The policy that pertains to the control that triggered the event, if applicable. For example the name of an anti-malware policy or an access control policy.

raw_data.caption: Raw Data
raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.

risk_details.caption: Risk Details
risk_details.description: Describes the risk associated with the finding.

risk_level.caption: Risk Level
risk_level.description: The risk level, normalized to the caption of the risk_level_id value.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The risk level is not mapped. See the risk_level attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

risk_score.caption: Risk Score
risk_score.description: The risk score as reported by the event source.

severity.caption: Severity
severity.description: The event/finding severity, normalized to the caption of the severity_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the source.

severity_id.caption: Severity ID
severity_id.description:
The normalized identifier of the event/finding severity.

The normalized severity is a measurement the effort and expense required to manage and resolve an event or incident. Smaller numerical values represent lower impact events, and larger numerical values represent higher impact events.

1.caption: Informational
1.description: Informational message. No action required.

2.caption: Low
2.description: The user decides if action is needed.

3.caption: Medium
3.description: Action is required but the situation is not serious at this time.

4.caption: High
4.description: Action is required immediately.

5.caption: Critical
5.description: Action is required immediately and the scope is broad.

6.caption: Fatal
6.description: An error occurred but it is too late to take remedial action.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The event/finding severity is not mapped. See the severity attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

start_time.caption: Start Time
start_time.description: The start time of a time period, or the time of the least recent event included in the aggregate event.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The event status, normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_id.description: The normalized identifier of the event status.

account.description: The Account object contains details about the account that initiated or performed a specific activity within a system or application. Additionally, the Account object refers to logical Cloud and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) based containers such as AWS Accounts, Azure Subscriptions, Oracle Cloud Compartments, Google Cloud Projects, and otherwise.

app_name.caption: Application Name
app_name.description: The client application or service that initiated the activity. This can be in conjunction with the user if present. Note that app_name is distinct from the process if present.

app_uid.caption: Application ID
app_uid.description: The unique identifier of the client application or service that initiated the activity. This can be in conjunction with the user if present. Note that app_name is distinct from the process.pid or process.uid if present.

authorizations.caption: Authorization Information
authorizations.description: Provides details about an authorization, such as authorization outcome, and any associated policies related to the activity/event.

remediation.description: Describes the recommended remediation steps to address identified issue(s).

affected_code.description: The Affected Code object describes details about a code block identified as vulnerable.
affected_code.name: affected_code

architecture.caption: Architecture
architecture.description: Architecture is a shorthand name describing the type of computer hardware the packaged software is meant to run on.

cpe_name.caption: The product CPE identifier
cpe_name.description: The Common Platform Enumeration (CPE) name as described by (NIST) For example: cpe:/a:apple:safari:16.2.

epoch.caption: Epoch
epoch.description: The software package epoch. Epoch is a way to define weighted dependencies based on version numbers.

fixed_in_version.caption: Fixed In Version
fixed_in_version.description: The software package version in which a reported vulnerability was patched/fixed.

hash.caption: Hash
hash.description: Cryptographic hash to identify the binary instance of a software component. This can include any component such file, package, or library.

license.description: The software license applied to this package.

package_manager.description: The software packager manager utilized to manage a package on a system, e.g. npm, yum, dpkg etc.

path.caption: Path
path.description: The installation path of the affected package.

purl.caption: Package URL
purl.description: A purl is a URL string used to identify and locate a software package in a mostly universal and uniform way across programming languages, package managers, packaging conventions, tools, APIs and databases.

name.description: The name of the agent or sensor. For example: AWS SSM Agent.

policies.caption: Agent Policies
policies.description: Describes the various policies that may be applied or enforced by an agent or sensor. E.g., Conditional Access, prevention, auto-update, tamper protection, destination configuration, etc.

raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.

type.caption: Agent Type
type.description: The normalized caption of the type_id value for the agent or sensor. In the case of 'Other' or 'Unknown', it is defined by the event source.

type_id.caption: Type ID
type_id.description: The normalized representation of an agent or sensor. E.g., EDR, vulnerability management, APM, backup & recovery, etc.

1.caption: Endpoint Detection and Response
1.description: Any EDR sensor or agent. Or any tool that provides similar threat detection, anti-malware, anti-ransomware, or similar capabilities. E.g., Crowdstrike Falcon, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Wazuh.

2.caption: Data Loss Prevention
2.description: Any DLP sensor or agent. Or any tool that provides similar data classification, data loss detection, and/or data loss prevention capabilities. E.g., Forcepoint DLP, Microsoft Purview, Symantec DLP.

3.caption: Backup & Recovery
3.description: Any agent or sensor that provides backups, archival, or recovery capabilities. E.g., Azure Backup, AWS Backint Agent.

4.caption: Performance Monitoring & Observability
4.description: Any agent or sensor that provides Application Performance Monitoring (APM), active tracing, profiling, or other observability use cases and optionally forwards the logs. E.g., New Relic Agent, Datadog Agent, Azure Monitor Agent.

5.caption: Vulnerability Management
5.description: Any agent or sensor that provides vulnerability management or scanning capabilities. E.g., Qualys VMDR, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Crowdstrike Spotlight, Amazon Inspector Agent.

6.caption: Log Forwarding
6.description: Any agent or sensor that forwards logs to a 3rd party storage system such as a data lake or SIEM. E.g., Splunk Universal Forwarder, Tenzir, FluentBit, Amazon CloudWatch Agent, Amazon Kinesis Agent.

7.caption: Mobile Device Management
7.description: Any agent or sensor responsible for providing Mobile Device Management (MDM) or Mobile Enterprise Management (MEM) capabilities. E.g., JumpCloud Agent, Esper Agent, Jamf Pro binary.

8.caption: Configuration Management
8.description: Any agent or sensor that provides configuration management of a device, such as scanning for software, license management, or applying configurations. E.g., AWS Systems Manager Agent, Flexera, ServiceNow MID Server.

9.caption: Remote Access
9.description: Any agent or sensor that provides remote access capabilities to a device. E.g., BeyondTrust, Amazon Systems Manager Agent, Verkada Agent.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Agent ID
uid.description: The UID of the agent or sensor, sometimes known as a Sensor ID or aid.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate Agent ID
uid_alt.description: An alternative or contextual identifier for the agent or sensor, such as a configuration, organization, or license UID.

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

vendor_name.caption: Vendor Name
vendor_name.description: The company or author who created the agent or sensor. For example: Crowdstrike.

version.caption: Agent Version
version.description: The semantic version of the agent or sensor, e.g., 7.101.50.0.

agent.caption: Agent
agent.description: An Agent (also known as a Sensor) is typically installed on an Operating System (OS) and serves as a specialized software component that can be designed to monitor, detect, collect, archive, or take action. These activities and possible actions are defined by the upstream system controlling the Agent and its intended purpose. For instance, an Agent can include Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) agents, backup/disaster recovery sensors, Application Performance Monitoring or profiling sensors, and similar software.
agent.name: agent

location.caption: Geo Location
location.description: The detailed geographical location usually associated with an IP address.

model.description: The model name of the aircraft or unmanned system.

raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.

serial_number.description: The serial number of the aircraft.

speed.caption: Speed
speed.description: Ground speed of flight. This value is provided in meters per second with a minimum resolution of 0.25 m/s. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 255 m/s.

speed_accuracy.caption: Speed Accuracy
speed_accuracy.description: Provides quality/containment on horizontal ground speed. Measured in meters/second.

track_direction.caption: Track Direction
track_direction.description: Direction of flight expressed as a “True North-based” ground track angle. This value is provided in clockwise degrees with a minimum resolution of 1 degree. If aircraft is not moving horizontally, use the “Unknown” value

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The primary identification identifier for an aircraft, such as the 24-bit International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) identifier of the aircraft, as 6 hex digits.

uid_alt.caption: Alternate ID
uid_alt.description: A secondary identification identifier for an aircraft, such as the 4-digit squawk (octal representation).

unmapped.caption: Unmapped Data
unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

vertical_speed.caption: Vertical Speed
vertical_speed.description: Vertical speed upward relative to the WGS-84 datum, measured in meters per second. Special Values: Invalid, No Value, or Unknown: 63 m/s.

aircraft.caption: Aircraft
aircraft.description: The Aircraft object represents any aircraft or otherwise airborne asset such as an unmanned system, airplane, balloon, spacecraft, or otherwise. The Aircraft object is intended to normalized data captured or otherwise logged from active radar, passive radar, multi-spectral systems, or the Automatic Dependant Broadcast - Surveillance (ADS-B), and/or Mode S systems.
aircraft.name: aircraft

desc.description: The description of the analytic that generated the finding.

name.description: The name of the analytic that generated the finding.

raw_data.description: The event data as received from the event source.

@deprecated.message: Related Analytics has been decoupled from this object, instead use finding_info.related_analytics.

related_analytics.caption: Related Analytics
related_analytics.description: Other analytics related to this analytic.

type.caption: Type
type.description: The analytic type.

1.caption: Rule
1.description: A Rule in security analytics refers to predefined criteria or conditions set to monitor, alert, or enforce policies, playing a crucial role in access control, threat detection, and regulatory compliance across security systems.

10.caption: Partial Data Match
10.description: Partial Data Match involves identifying instances where segments of sensitive information or patterns match, facilitating nuanced DLP and threat detection without requiring complete data conformity.

11.caption: Indexed Data Match
11.description: Indexed Data Match refers to comparing content against a pre-compiled index of sensitive information to efficiently detect and prevent unauthorized access or breaches, streamlining DLP and compliance efforts.

2.caption: Behavioral
2.description: Behavioral analytics focus on monitoring and analyzing user or system actions to identify deviations from established patterns, aiding in the detection of insider threats, fraud, and advanced persistent threats (APTs).

3.caption: Statistical
3.description: Statistical analytics pertains to analyzing data patterns and anomalies using statistical models to predict, detect, and respond to potential threats, enhancing overall security posture through informed decision-making.

4.caption: Learning (ML/DL)
4.description: Learning (ML/DL) encompasses techniques that can "learn" from known data to create analytics that generalize to new data. There may be a statistical component to these techniques, but it is not a requirement.

5.caption: Fingerprinting
5.description: Fingerprinting is the technique of collecting detailed system data, including software versions and configurations, to enhance threat detection, data loss prevention (DLP), and endpoint detection and response (EDR) capabilities.

6.caption: Tagging
6.description: Tagging refers to the practice of assigning labels or identifiers to data, users, assets, or activities to monitor, control access, and facilitate incident response across various security domains such as DLP and EDR.

7.caption: Keyword Match
7.description: Keyword Match involves scanning content for specific terms to identify sensitive information, potential threats, or policy violations, aiding in DLP and compliance monitoring.

8.caption: Regular Expressions
8.description: Regular Expressions are used to define complex search patterns for identifying, validating, and extracting specific data sets or threats within digital content, enhancing DLP, EDR, and threat detection mechanisms.

9.caption: Exact Data Match
9.description: Exact Data Match is a precise comparison technique used to detect the unauthorized use or exposure of specific, sensitive information, crucial for enforcing DLP policies and protecting against data breaches.

99.caption: Other
99.description: The type is not mapped. See the type attribute, which contains a data source specific value.

uid.caption: Unique ID
uid.description: The unique identifier of the analytic that generated the finding.

unmapped.description: The attributes that are not mapped to the event schema. The names and values of those attributes are specific to the event source.

analytic.description: The Analytic object contains details about the analytic technique used to analyze and derive insights from the data or information that led to the creation of a finding or conclusion.

compliance_references.caption: Compliance Standard References

compliance_standards.description: A list of established guidelines or criteria that define specific requirements an organization must follow.

control.description: A Control is prescriptive, prioritized, and simplified set of best practices that one can use to strengthen their cybersecurity posture. e.g. AWS SecurityHub Controls, CIS Controls.

status.caption: Status
status.description: The resultant status of the compliance check normalized to the caption of the status_id value. In the case of 'Other', it is defined by the event source.

status_detail.caption: Status Detail
status_detail.description: The contextual description of the status, status_code values.

1.description: The compliance check passed for all the evaluated resources.

2.caption: Warning
